verbose_text: In addition to blotting for various membrane proteins in crude lysates, immobilized wheat germ agglutinin (WGA), a lectin that binds to galactose and sialic acid moieties, was used to enrich for Golgi and post-Golgi localized glycosylated membrane proteins from lysates of control or KD cells where the retromer components VPS26 or SNX1, or SFT2D2, ZDHHC5, or GRINA, were silenced (XREF_FIG A).
evidence: agglutinin (WGA), a lectin that binds to galactose
